channel.title: Green Ruby
channel.description: Green Ruby News is a feed of fresh links of the week about ruby, javascript, webdev, devops, collected by mose every sunday

item.title: Green Ruby News #092
item.description: My new job is much deeper in devops than before. Gandi really is a great environment for real geeks. Rails and ruby still remains dear to my heart, but now this becomes a side interest for me. I hope I still can keep up with this weekly gathering of links. Some focus may change though. I'm switching now from chef to puppet, and I may have even more interest on devops links. But I will try to keep it balanced. Maybe organize the links gathering a little more collaboratively?
item.content:encoded:
#092 - nov 9th 2014

Edito

My new job is much deeper in devops than before. Gandi really is a great environment for real geeks. Rails and ruby still remains dear to my heart, but now this becomes a side interest for me. I hope I still can keep up with this weekly gathering of links. Some focus may change though. I'm switching now from chef to puppet, and I may have even more interest on devops links. But I will try to keep it balanced. Maybe organize the links gathering a little more collaboratively?

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
TwoFold
Website of a design agency, pretty beautiful.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Bada55
BADA55.io is about finding the most badass leet words for your CSS hex colors.
Useful Chrome Extensions for Designers & Developers
20 chrome extensions you may need.
Do
Helps people run productive meetings.
Stackshare
Discover what top companies are using.
Cheatography
Cheat sheet generator and repository where you can build and share cheat sheets.
Pixelapse
Visual version control and collaboration workflow for open source and private design projects.
Google Container Engine
Run Docker containers on Google Cloud Platform, powered by Kubernetes.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.2 packages for Ubuntu
Brightbox packaged ruby 2.2.0 preview 1.
Shoryuken
AWS SQS thread based message processor for Ruby.
Pronto
Quick automated code review of your changes.
RailsStats
See stuff about a Rails app.
Close Enough
For dyslexic coders. Yes, it's a joke.
Twemoji
Open sourcing Twitter emoji for everyone.
Stager
Automatically build staging environments from GitHub pull requests.
Materialize
A modern responsive front-end framework based on Material Design.
ShadowCrypt
Encrypt your social communications.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Getting Started with Hadoop nov 3
Basics of what Hadoop is, what options are out there, setting up a basic cluster.
Why your code is so hard to understand nov 3
Why my code makes perfect sense while I am writing it but looks like gibberish when I go back to it later.
Benchmarking Rack Middleware nov 3
If we can't measure something, we can't make it fast.
'respond_to' Without All the Pain nov 3
If you want to return different information for different formats, you have a few options.
Rails Rumble Gem Teardown nov 4
166 Gemfiles analyzed to see what tools rails rumblers have used.
Fluentd Goes Gopher nov 4
Fluentd forwarder now will be written in go (like logstash forwarder, interestingly).
AngularJS: The Bad Parts nov 5
Opinion: Whatever the reason is for Angulars popularity, it isn’t that it’s a great framework.
The Ruby Ecosystem for New Rubyists nov 6
Review of various initial ruby tools that newcomers to ruby should be aware about.
Rust and Go nov 7
Brief comparison between Rust and Go, picking up on some of the nice features in both.
Lazy Refactoring nov 7
Example of step by step refactoring using lazy enumerators.
State Machines in Ruby nov 7
Example of step by step refactoring using lazy enumerators.
Layout Math with CSS: Understanding calc nov 8
A couple of examples of usage of calc() in css.
PID tracking in modern init systems nov 9
Two ways of enabling daemons to coexist with upstart and systemd.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Time Zones using the local_time Gem (12m) nov 6
A look into times, timezones, and how to handle it better with javascript.
DevOps Enterprise Summit 2014 (27 videos) nov 6
Recordings of talks from the DevOps Enterprise Summit, held October 21 - 23, 2014.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant Robots 121 (32m) nov 3
Prolificness (Allison House)
Ruby5 507 (7m) nov 4
Rubinius 2.3.0, Zopfli-ffi, Benchmarking Rack, Enums and Queries, Ruby Garbage Collector, Hunting for Leaks in Ruby.
CenturyLink Labs #20 (35m) nov 4
Geeking Out On APIs With Wynn Netherland from GitHub.
NodeUp 75 (52m) nov 4
A nodeforward show.
Food Fight Show 83 (52m) nov 4
DevOpsDays Belgium 2014.
The ShipShow 51 (1h) nov 4
Five Years of DevOps (and Its Days).
RubyRogues 180 (59m) nov 5
Barriers to New Developers with Kinsey Ann Durham.
Javascript Jabber 132 (58m) nov 5
MV Frameworks with Craig McKeachie.
Adventure in angular #15 (34m) nov 6
Angular and Kendo UI with Jesse Liberty.
Web Platform #17 (1h06) nov 6
The Famo.us vision of 'Mobile First'.
Ruby5 508 (6m) nov 7
Rails Rumble Gem, Shopify admin, 4 ways to setup minitest, Rails with Ember.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 175 (1h06) nov 7
Carlos Souza from Code School.
The Cloudcast #170 (35m) nov 8
Reigniting of the Cloud Wars.

item.title: Green Ruby News #091
item.description: This week I left my job at Faria and I joined Gandi Asia, as a devops again. The consequence is that I'm flying to Paris next week for one month. I wonder if I will be able to feed up Greenruby links curation as regularly as usual. That may be challenging. In the while, check out the Rails Rumble Winners for this year, there is some cool things.
item.content:encoded:
#091 - nov 2nd 2014

Edito

This week I left my job at Faria and I joined Gandi Asia, as a devops again. The consequence is that I'm flying to Paris next week for one month. I wonder if I will be able to feed up Greenruby links curation as regularly as usual. That may be challenging. In the while, check out the Rails Rumble Winners for this year, there is some cool things.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Benoît Boucart
Benoît Boucart, a web designer, made a nice looking timeline.
Emoji Tracker
Realtime emoji use on twitter.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Trailblazer book
(Book) A New Architecture For Rails (writing still in progress).
Polarr
A WebGL photo editor faster than Adobe Lightroom.
Gitgo
Free private version control hosting, charging per volume above 200M, not per accounts or repos.
Orion
Open Source Platform For Cloud Based Development, online IDE from eclipse.
Whiteout
Email encryption for the rest of us.
Packager
Distributing and installing modern web applications, automatically packaged.
Magic Import
The fastest way to turn a webpage into a table of data.
ZenHub
Turns GitHub Issues into real time draggable cards on shared Boards.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.1.4
Mostly a security release, with also some bugfixes.
Rails 3.2.20, 4.0.11, 4.1.7, and 4.2.0.beta3
A security upgrade related to CVE-2014-7818.
Rails 4.2.0.beta4
The beta3 was just a security upgrade, this beta4 contains the real changes towards RC.
Rubinius 2.3.0
A big changelog for this new version of rbx.
TTY::ProgressBar
A flexible progress bars drawing in terminal emulators.
rdoc-generator-mdoc
This generator outputs gem documentation in man format.
RailsScript
Rails-centric, object oriented, featherweight framework for writing CoffeeScript.
Dashboards
Responsive Dashboard Templates for Bootstrap.
linux_provision
Library for provisioning initial setup of Linux computer for Ruby/Rails development.
OSquery
Use SQL to query low-level operating system information.
pgweb
Web-based PostgreSQL database browser written in Go.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Adding reentrancy fallback for your Sidekiq workers oct 27
A nice way to implement reentrancy.
I Went to Haskell and All I Got Was a Pattern Matcher for Ruby oct 27
Defp is a pattern matcher implementation written for and in ruby.
Containerization, Security and Trust Models oct 27
New signed builds in docker 1.3 brings the topic of trust and key management.
Let’s Get Serious About Readability oct 28
What makes code readable.
In search of the perfect JavaScript framework oct 28
Review of the criteria to take in account when making a choice of js framework.
jQuery 3.0: The Next Generations oct 29
How compat will be handled in the next verion os jquery.
Memoization in Ruby Using Metaprogramming oct 29
Example of memoization with a function that calculates factorial recursively.
Real World Examples of Rails Engines in Action oct 29
4 rails engine examined (forem, devise, spree, refinery).
4 Fantastic Ways to Set Up State in Minitest oct 29
How to add the missing parts for minitest to compete with Rspec.
What I Learned About Hunting Memory Leaks in Ruby 2.1 oct 30
Example and resources to optimize ruby programs, checking rbtrace dumps.
Ruby is about to get red hot. Again. oct 30
Various ruby-based solutions to bring ruby everywhere (especially volt and rubyfire seem cool, for web apps).
How to write code that speaks for itself oct 30
Self documenting code is code that speaks for itself.
Feature Flags on Rails oct 30
Use the Rollout gem as a way of implementing Feature flags.
The Best Plugins for Sublime Text oct 30
Subjective but extensive list of ST3 plugins.
PGP and You oct 31
Great primer that enables encrypted communication between individuals (more and more a required concern).

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
AtoZ CSS: z-index (8m) oct 30
Stacking order for DOM elements.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Product Hunt Radio 27 (43m) oct 28
Talking about Hackathons.
CodePen 025 (36m) oct 28
Payments, Stripe, IPN.
Giant Robots 120 (54m) oct 28
Open Your World For Commentary (Tom Lehman)
Ruby5 506 (6m) oct 28
Pocketsphinx-ruby, Lita, ognivo, Neo4j in rails, rails rumble winners.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 174 (1h11) oct 29
Introduction to Ninefold for Rails Hosting.
RubyRogues 179 (1h32) oct 29
Accountability and Diversity with Meagan Waller.
Javascript Jabber 131 (49m) oct 29
Conferences & Meetups with Dave Nugent.
The Cloudcast #168 (22m) oct 29
Containerized Continuous Delivery.
The Cloudcast #169 (26m) oct 29
DevOps Incident Management with BigPanda.
CenturyLink Labs #19 (37m) oct 29
Making Clustered Infra Look Like One Big Server with Mesosphere and Florian Leibert.
Adventure in angular #14 (38m) oct 30
Using ES6 with Angular with Scott Allen.
Web Platform #16 (1h09) nov 1
Measures of Success in Pair Programming.

item.title: Green Ruby News #090
item.description: Rails Rumble 2014 winners will be announced in a few hours, you can check the list of submissions. There is a lot of creative ideas over there.
item.content:encoded:
#090 - oct 26th 2014

Edito

Rails Rumble 2014 winners will be announced in a few hours, you can check the list of submissions. There is a lot of creative ideas over there.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Nice and Serious
An ethically-driven creative agency.
All the free Stock
Get all the Free Stock Images, Videos and Icons in one location.
Piccolo
A pocket sized open source CNC-bot, arduino based.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Learn Ruby on Rails
Learn Ruby on Rails as You Modify a Craigslist Clone.
Cursors
All available cursors in one page.
Case studies
(Book) Exciting Web Projects: Conception to Execution.
Userium
Checklist to catch common usability problems before user testing.
Netlify
Builds, deploys and host static websites and apps.
Targeted
Test your email designs across 30+ email clients before you send them.
Awesome WPO
A curated list of Web Performance Optimization.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby Raptor
A radically new Ruby web server (to be released next month).
Did you mean
The 'Did you mean?' experience in Ruby code debugging.
Einhorn
Language-independent shared socket manager.
Snap.svg
The JavaScript SVG library for the modern web.
Exoskeleton
Faster and leaner Backbone for your HTML5 apps.
Tug
Docker development workflow (could be compared to fig).
Stocker
Manage environment variables securely.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Rails vs. Sinatra by Example oct 19
Relative merits of Rails and Sinatra by building the same app in both frameworks.
Sacrificial Architecture oct 20
Build something to be able to throw away in some time.
Career planning: Where do old devs go to? oct 20
Interesting feedback from old timers (people like me).
Writing Better Tests With the Three-phase Pattern oct 20
Follow the Arrange, Act, Assert sequence.
Learning React.js: Getting Started and Concepts oct 20
Some React basics, first installment in a new series of tutorials.
LevelDB in Ruby oct 22
How to use LevelDB with a Ruby wrapper.
5 Free eBooks for Learning Ruby on Rails Framework oct 22
How to use LevelDB with a Ruby wrapper.
localForage vs. XHR oct 22
Fetching from IndexedDB is about 5-15 times faster than fetching from AJAX.
Eight Docker Development Patterns oct 22
A docker enthousiast shares some patterns that have started to show up repeatedly.
Get an A in SSL class oct 23
How to score A+ in your ssllabs test.
How JavaScript is Going to Replace Node.js oct 24
Seems there is some kind of controversy around node.js governance.
Human-Centered Typography oct 24
Treating text as an interface is as much about usability as it is enjoyment and ease.
Wobbly slideshow effect oct 24
Experimental slideshow effect taht wobbles.
Diving in Rails - Exceptions handling oct 25
How rails catches exceptions, and how you can customize it.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Rocky Mountain Ruby 2014 (12 videos) oct 21
Rocky Mountain Ruby from september 25.
Nickel City Ruby Conference 2014 (15 videos) oct 21
Nickel City Ruby from oct 3.
Gorails 29 (20m) oct 23
Email Notifications with Rails 4.2, deliver_later, and Previews.
AtoZ CSS: rotateY (7m) oct 23
Rotate elements and how perspective works.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Food Fight Show 81 (1h03) oct 18
Even MOAR Windows.
Food Fight Show 82 (25m) oct 18
Live From Chef Summit London 2014.
DevOps Cafe 56 (1h05) oct 20
Complexity and Failure with Sidney Dekker.
Giant Robots 119 (27m) oct 20
Create Value or Create Technology? (Pete Hunt).
Ruby5 504 (5m) oct 21
UltraHook, Capybara Tests, Einhorn, Barcelona Ruby Conf, Raptor.
RubyRogues 178 (1h15) oct 22
Book Club: Refactoring Ruby with Martin Fowler.
Javascript Jabber 130 (1h07) oct 22
Browser Tools and Extensions.
The Cloudcast #166 (26m) oct 22
Creating a Docker Cloud with Clocker.
Adventure in angular #13 (38m) oct 23
Modern Web and Open Source with Scott Hanselman.
The Cloudcast #167 (30m) oct 24
Bringing Advanced Analytics to DevOps (pagerduty).
Ruby5 505 (6m) oct 24
ENVied, Payola, Pippi, multithreading in MRI, Practicing Rails.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 173 (1h) oct 25
Rails Rumble 2014 Entries.

item.title: Green Ruby News #089
item.description: This weekend Rails Rumble is ending up right now. Results will have to wait one week but I bet there will be interesting projects to check out.
item.content:encoded:
#089 - oct 19th 2014

Edito

This weekend Rails Rumble is ending up right now. Results will have to wait one week but I bet there will be interesting projects to check out.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Fluky
Make you own wheel of fortune and roll it.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Rails beginner cheatsheet
This is not a new site, but it can help onboard new rubyists.
Fast ruby
List of benchmarking examples of ruby code, comparing alternatives.
Mastering Modern Payments
(Book) Complete guide to getting paid with Stripe and Rails.
FormKeep
Form endpoints for designers and developers.
GildeRoom
Hangouts without the hangups (webrtc based).
Sublime Text Power User
(Book) Get intimate with Sublime Text.
Bee Free
Online mail composer for campaigns, by Mailup.
TinyScreen
A color display the size of your thumb.
React Fundamentals
Basic fundamentals of React to get you started.
Learn all the nodes
Screencasts about node.js.
Intro to D3.js
This tutorial provides a quick intro to D3.js (not a deep dive).
Building Web Apps with Go
(Book) Learn how to build and deploy web applications with Go..

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby Raptor
A radically new Ruby web server (to be released next month).
Ruboto 1.2.0
JRuby on Android, new version.
Nightmare
A high level wrapper for Phantomjs.
Stack.gl
Open software ecosystem for WebGL, built on top of browserify and npm.
Pageres
Responsive website screenshots from the commandline.
EditorConfig
Helps developers maintain consistent coding styles between different editors.
Fig 1.0
A ton of improvements in this release, including compatibility with boot2docker on OS X.
Dockerize
Utility to simplify running applications in docker containers.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Build your own Google TV Using RaspberryPi, NodeJS and Socket.io oct 13
Full tutorial based on the RaspberryPi-Tv project.
How Does Rails Handle Gems? oct 13
How do Bundler, Rails, and RubyGems work together to make handling dependencies easy.
Leverage Bundler to Get Private Git Repos on Docker Images oct 14
Handle gems based on private repos in docker images.
Polymorphic relations with pg_morph oct 14
Simplify your life with pg_morph.
How Poodle Happened oct 14
Detailled history about this last SSL hole.
CSS-Only Solution For UI Tracking oct 16
CSS-only approach for tracking UI interactions using Google Analytics.
How to Conduct A Content Audit oct 16
For any kind of redesign project you may need to perform a content audit.
8 steps to move Rails view to Marionette oct 16
Use Devise with AngularJS.
How to Set Up Authentication with AngularJS and Ruby on Rails oct 17
Howto with code for moving rails views to backbone and marionette.
Clean Up After Your Capybara oct 17
Avoid the tangled web of test code and markup.
Build a Custom API to Connect WordPress With Ruby on Rails oct 19
The Grape gem for creating an API to expose a part of a Ruby on Rails based shopping cart to outside applications.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
RubyMotion for Rails Developers (16m) oct 13
Create a Hello World application in rubymotion.
AtoZ CSS: TranslateX (5m) oct 16
Performance benefits of using translate over other methods.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant Robots 118 (37m) oct 13
Scare Yourself (Dan Martell).
Ruby5 502 (6m) oct 14
RailsRumble, Ruby Motion for Rails devs, Ruby Hashes, data migrations, clean routes, better logs.
NodeUp 74 (47m) oct 14
A future of npm show.
Arrested DevOps 23 (1h) oct 14
Managing Systems In The Cloud.
Ops All The Things 011 (50m) oct 14
All About Attitude.
The Cloudcast #165 (28m) oct 15
DevOps Automation as a Service.
Ruby5 503 (6m) oct 16
Unary Operators, Writing fast Ruby, each_with_object, ES6 Transpiler, HStore.
Adventure in angular #12 (32m) oct 16
Directives.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 172 (59m) oct 17
heyswell.com and Rails Rumble countdown.
Web Platform #14 (1h08) oct 17
Web Components Interop and Polymer.
The Ship Show 50 (1h04) oct 17
Notes to Your Butler (jenkins).

item.title: Green Ruby News #088
item.description: If you understand japanese, check the presentation of tenderlove at rubykaigi. Damn he's good.
item.content:encoded:
#088 - oct 12th 2014

Edito

If you understand japanese, check the presentation of tenderlove at rubykaigi. Damn he's good.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Designspiration
Resource to help discover and share great design.
The grid
AI websites that design themselves.
Pablo the flamingo
Totally useless dancing flamingo (also check the behind the scene).

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Dev Free Casts
A huge collection of free screencasts for devs.
DevToolsTips
Curated collection of Chrome Developer Tools tips and tricks.
Rails Crash Course
(Book) A No-Nonsense Guide to Rails Development.
Code Fights
Code challenges that test how fast you can debug JavaScript.
Must-Watch CSS
A useful list of must-watch videos about CSS.
Programming course comparison
13 popular options for learning how to code, analyzed and compared.
35 Useful HTML5, JavaScript Tools and jQuery Plugins
Another of those lists, this one has some nice entries.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Quick Secure
Simple script for hardening and securing base linux systems.
Taste Tester
The test-tester utility for testing chef diffs via chef-zero.
PerfMap
Front-end performance heatmap bookmarklet.
kibana-rack
Embed Kibana as a Rack application and creates a proxy to Elasticsearch.
ClassyCancan
Classify your cancancan abilities.
easy-emoji
Make the emoji easier to use for Rails.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Move fast & break nothing oct 3
Transcript of a talk from Zach Holman from Github. Very long and very wise.
Top 8 tools for Ruby on Rails code optimization and cleanup oct 6
Keeping your code clean and organized while developing a large Rails application.
Three Great Ways to Learn Ruby Faster oct 6
In short: Ruby Quiz, Exercism.io and try a tiny app.
What’s wrong with Angular.js oct 6
Not everybody is happy about angular. This one explains why, and gets bunch of interesting comments in return.
What I would recommend instead of Angular.js? oct 7
Sequel of the previous one.
The best developer tools, now free for students oct 7
The GitHub Student Developer Pack.
Cleaning up a Rails routes file oct 7
Large Rails apps have a way of gathering cruft. One popular cruft hideout is config/routes.rb.
Introducing Leche oct 7
A JavaScript Testing Utility for Mocha and Sinon.
Object Oriented Programming is an expensive disaster which must end oct 7
A very long writing about OOP. only go there if you have time and brain cells to dedicate to it. Spoiler, functionnal programming is the new black.
Memoization in Ruby, Python and Javascript oct 8
How the different languages haadle memoization.
Analyze ruby execution stack with #caller oct 8
Make backtrace your custom debugging tool with #caller.
Tail Call Optimisation in MRI oct 9
TCO is disabled by default, but it's good to know what it does.
Why Ruby Is the Crown Jewel in a Developer's Resume oct 9
Demand for Ruby on Rails talent continues at a steady pace.
Rebuild a Gem: Rack oct 10
Exercise to rewrite rack for educative purpose.
Refactoring From Model to View Helper to Null Object oct 10
Replacing conditional with polymorphism.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Crash Course on MySQL (23m) oct 8
Common tasks associated with looking after a single MySQL server.
Rules of Devops (35m) oct 8
Talk given at DeveopDay Chicago about devops culture.
AtoZ CSS: Widows (5m) oct 9
Paged media, Widows and Orphans.
Nested Attributes and fields_for (9m) oct 9
Forum Series Part 3 from gorails.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Food Fight 201410 (1h22) oct 7
Windows Automation for Frustrated Sysadmins.
Ruby5 501 (6m) oct 7
Rails data migrations, tools for optimization, Bundler::Updater, UUID with Postgres, Active Record, Ruby 2.2.0.
Ruby Rogues 177 (1h17) oct 8
Creativity and Technology.
Javascript Jabber 129 (54m) oct 8
BaaS with Ryan Done.
NodeUp 73 (1h04) oct 9
An internet of things show.
Adventure in angular #11 (34m) oct 10
Angular Fire with David East and Kato Wulf.
Web Platform #13 (1h07) oct 10
MeshBlu, NPM, and The Internet of Everywhere.

item.title: Green Ruby News #087
item.description:
As there is a lot of new subscribers this week, let me remind you what this newsletter is.
I'm a french fullstack geek living in Taiwan, ruby lover, and currently in a devops phase. I don't have much time to surf around during the week as I have a fulltime job. So every Sunday I dedicate 4 to 6 hours to sort my inbox, check stuff, track what's new, so I can remain current.
And then as I'm doing it for myself, well, I structured it a bit and sent my review to some friends. Mailchimp offers a free tier, the review is done already, why not share it to a wider audience. Xenor sends me some links every week, as well as various other people now. Having more people reading it and appreciating this review helps me to stay motivated doing it every week. So, thanks for that.
item.content:encoded:
#087 - oct 5th 2014

Edito

As there is a lot of new subscribers this week, let me remind you what this newsletter is.
I'm a french fullstack geek living in Taiwan, ruby lover, and currently in a devops phase. I don't have much time to surf around during the week as I have a fulltime job. So every Sunday I dedicate 4 to 6 hours to sort my inbox, check stuff, track what's new, so I can remain current.
And then as I'm doing it for myself, well, I structured it a bit and sent my review to some friends. Mailchimp offers a free tier, the review is done already, why not share it to a wider audience. Xenor sends me some links every week, as well as various other people now. Having more people reading it and appreciating this review helps me to stay motivated doing it every week. So, thanks for that.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
e3creative
Website of a digital agency.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Readme.io
Project documentation made easy.
Inline Manual
Interactive inline tutorials.
Sache
Discover Sass & Compass Extensions.
Xip.io
xip.io is a magic domain name that provides wildcard DNS for any IP address.
A Day in the Life of an Ember Developer
A free webinar with Yahuda Katz on October 16.
Enjoycss
Advanced online CSS3 generator.
Color code
Find your color scheme.
Freepik
Free Graphic Files for Download.
Taiga
Taiga is a project management platform for startups and agile developers (open source).
Internet Explorer Platform
The Internet Explorer team is looking for feature requests from the web developer community.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rails 4.2.0 beta2
Security fixes and some breaking changes (with beta1).
Spec me Maybe
Introduces the 'maybe' syntax to RSpec.
Inspeqtor
A go daemon to replace monit, by the author of sidekiq.
chef-koans
An experimental, test-driven way to learn about Chef.
Csstyle
Csstyle is a modern approach for crafting maintainable stylesheets.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
10 skills that will make you a better Rubyist sep 29
Skills required to advance your career (and get a better salary.
Adding a staging environment to Rails sep 29
A staging environment is a perfect place to battle test your code under the conditions of production.
How Do Gems Work? sep 29
Knowing RubyGems even at this surface level will help out a lot.
Benefits of Writing a DSL in Ruby sep 29
Creating a domain specific language to accelerate and streamline the development process.
How GitHub is using Web Components in production sep 29
Ssking some questions to Joshua Peek, a programmer at GitHub.
Responsive Images with srcset sep 30
If you’re just changing resolutions, use srcset.
Hacker's Guide to Setting up Your Mac sep 30
Some techniques to apply automation to the setup of your Mac.
CDN acceptance testing oct 1
How gov.uk migrated to one CDN provider to another. Bonus, the source code of their tests.
Getting Started With Active Job oct 1
With the release of Rails 4.2, Active Job abstracts background workers syntax.
Taste and The Zen of GitHub oct 2
What taste means in Github growth.
Code Reviews at Harvest oct 2
Some good ideas about how to do the code review.
What is kubernetes and how to use it oct 2
Solution to scale your web services both vertically and horizontally.
Rails with Webpack - Why and How oct 2
An alternative for bundling your assets for some projects.
Refactoring Ruby with Monads oct 3
How monads can help to make code simpler, clearer and more reusable.
Better Know Enumerable: Partition oct 3
Using the partition to split a collection into two complementary parts.
AngularJS Tutorial: A Comprehensive 10,000 Word Guide oct 3
An ultimate resource point to begin learning AngularJS.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
AtoZ CSS: Vertical-align (5m) oct 1
The vertical-align property and how and when it works.
Gogaruco 2014 (13 videos) oct 3
Golden Gate Ruby Conference.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
DevOps cafe 55 (1h12) sep 30
With Tom Limoncelli.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 170 (1h11) oct 1
Salesforce $1 Million Hackathon @ Dreamforce 2014.
Ruby Rogues 176 (58m) oct 1
Rails as an SOA Client with Pete Hodgson.
Javascript Jabber 128 (55m) oct 1
Famo.us with Steve Newcomb.
The Ship Show 49 (1h04) oct 1
The Pulse of PuppetConf 2014.
CodePen #24 (31m) oct 2
Our Responsibilities at CodePen.
Adventure in angular #10 (34m) oct 2
Preferred Backends with Angular.
Ruby5 500 (6m) oct 3
Greenscreen.io, onboarding your junior devs, better Rubyist, staging environments, absolutes.
The Cloudcast #164 (28m) oct 3
Full-Stack Real-Time Monitoring from the Cloud. Datadog.

item.title: Green Ruby News #086
item.description: This is the week of ShellShock, as most of you already know, this is going to be a troubled time for old servers again (well, who still uses cgi scripts, right?). On a brighter side, I also went to rails pacific yesterday, it was nice to meet some Green Ruby subscribers there.
item.content:encoded:
#086 - sep 28th 2014

Edito

This is the week of ShellShock, as most of you already know, this is going to be a troubled time for old servers again (well, who still uses cgi scripts, right?). On a brighter side, I also went to rails pacific yesterday, it was nice to meet some Green Ruby subscribers there.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Guillaume Bouvet
Very graphical website for a carpenter craftsman.
Dropbox Guides
New guide for dropbox users is a piece of work.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Regex 101
Yet another regexp online testing tool.
Ruby Science
(Book) The reference for writing fantastic Rails applications.
Material Design
Bootstrap theme based on Google Material design.
Awesome Shell
A curated list of awesome command-line frameworks, toolkits, guides and gizmos.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
ScrLib
Polyglot code analysis library, built with hackability in mind.
Trailblazer
Thin layer on top of Rails, with a more modern code structure.
Rails Disco
A distributed party with commands, events and projections.
Pact
Consumer driven contract testing framework.
TTY
The Ruby toolbox that you can use for building CLI projects.
Bash Booster
When Chef is too heavy, use Bash Booster, using Bash only.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
You Don't Have to Be Afraid to Test Your UI sep 21
About Page Object Pattern and Site prism gem.
npm 2.0.0 details sep 22
All the story behind npm 2.
Various ways to create structs sep 22
Some thinking about creating structs.
Onboarding Junior Developers sep 23
Thoughts on Kate Heddleston’s talk at GoGaRuCo 2014.
How I deploy a Rails app using Docker sep 23
Getting an app deployed inside a Docker container..
Wrapping Your API In A Custom Ruby Gem sep 25
If you have an API, publishing a gem for using it makes sense.
Build a rails application without database sep 26
Occasionally, you may want to build a Rails app without ActiveRecord.
Prefer Objects as Method Parameters, Not Class Names sep 26
Some kind of class-oriented programming.
Why You Should be Excited About Hadoop 2.0 sep 26
Hadoop 2.0 is a whole new elephant.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
Velocity Conference 2014 (30 videos) sep 21
Web performance and operations.
AtoZ CSS: Unicode-range (6m) sep 24
About font-face and unicode-range.
Gorails #25 (16m) sep 28
Forum Series Part 1: Architecture.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #117 (27m) sep 22
Designing Quality (Will Sulinski).
Ruby5 498 (7m) sep 23
Ruby 2.1.3, Goldiloader, Airborne, Eager Loading, Daemons, Swift for Rubyists.
Ruby Rogues 175 (41m) sep 24
Civic Hacking with William Jeffries.
Javascript Jabber 127 (56m) sep 24
Changes in npm-Land with Forrest Norvell, Rebecca Turner, Ben Coe, and Isaac Z. Schlueter.
Web platform #12 (57m) sep 26
Flux Application Architecture & React.
The Cloudcast #163 (27m) sep 26
Evolution of CoreOS.
Ruby5 499 (5m) sep 26
shell shock, hangar, rubytapas, from tails 3.2 to 4.3, burn.

item.title: Green Ruby News #085
item.description: There is some people every day on our irc channel, but as I wanted to try slack I opened a room there too (recent upgrades on hipchat were very annoying). Poke me if you want an invite to join it, for some chatting, or just if you want to see how slack works.
item.content:encoded:
#085 - sep 21th 2014

Edito

There is some people every day on our irc channel, but as I wanted to try slack I opened a room there too (recent upgrades on hipchat were very annoying). Poke me if you want an invite to join it, for some chatting, or just if you want to see how slack works.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
Endless Icons
A collection of free flat icons and creative stuff.
Design Patterns
Collections of patterns from Codepen contributions.
Party mode
Experimental music visualizer using d3.js and the web audio api.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Sinatra cookbook
(book) nothing to do with chef, all about Sinatra.
Ruby Gotchas
Collection of some good small gotchas when you write ruby script.
Algomation
Platform for creating and sharing didactic visualizations of algorithms.
CollabShot
Real time collaboration for screen grabs.
Weekend hacker
Find ideas for your weekends.
SpeedCurve
Monitor front-end performance.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Ruby 2.1.3
Contains a change of full GC timing to reduce memory consumption.
Elixir v1.0.03
Elixir finally reached a stable milestone.
Katon
Alternative to Pow development tool, with a wider scope (Node, Ruby, Python, Go, ..).
Bosonic
Set of tools to build and use reusable Web Components.
SweetLogger
A rails logger that don't let log entries for concurrent requests overlap.
Volt
A ruby web framework where your ruby runs on both server and client.
Nomad
World-Class Command Line Utilities For iOS Development.
CosmosBrowserAndroid
Connect to internet by SMS, no data or wifi required.
Rickshaw
JavaScript toolkit for creating interactive time series graphs (based on D3).
Tinycon
A small library for manipulating the favicon.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Working With Complex SQL Statements in Rails and ActiveRecord sep 14
Write your own activerecord method with custom postgresql sql code.
Daemonizing Ruby Processes sep 15
How-to for daemonizing Ruby code without adding any new dependencies.
A Lightweight Way to Handle Different Validation Situations sep 15
Some cases of conditional validations.
Upgrading GitHub to Rails 3 with Zero Downtime sep 15
How they did it, plus some metrics.
Successful Tools in Remote Work sep 16
Communication is king. It has to be, otherwise it all falls apart.
Getting Started with CSS Shapes sep 16
Wrapping content around custom paths.
Postgres Window Functions sep 16
Advanced sorting and limiting on a subset of a joined table of data.
The Rails + Angular equation can give you satisfaction sep 17
Simple example or rails combined with angular.
Everything About Rake Tasks sep 17
What Makes a Rake Task a Good Task?
4 ways Docker fundamentally changes application development sep 17
How Docker containers streamline development and deployment.
9 ways to speed up your RSpec tests sep 19
Various tips to make your tests faster.
Splitting monolithic Rails applications sep 19
An approach for making a rails application more modular.
ActiveRecord Eager Loading with Query Objects and Decorators sep 19
Also illustrates the use of the postgres window function.
Testing Page Objects with SitePrism sep 19
SitePrism is a Page Object Model DSL for Capybara.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
AtoZ CSS: text (7m) sep 16
Quick reference about all the text css styles.
Tom Dale talks about the humans behind Tilde and Ember.js (40m) sep 17
Bonus: A tour of their office.
The Raw Experience of Setting Up RubyMotion for Android (36m) sep 18
RubyMotion's support for Android has finally reached public beta.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #116 (32m) sep 15
A Model Jellyfish (Carl Smith).
Web platform #11 (54m) sep 15
The Bosonic Project.
Nodeup 72 (1h35) sep 15
A webgl show.
Ruby5 496 (6m) sep 16
Volt, fast tests, protect from forgery, upmin admin.
Ruby Rogues 174 (1h14) sep 17
Rubygems with Eric Hodel.
Javascript Jabber 126 (59m) sep 17
The Ionic Framework with Max Lynch and Tyler Renelle.
CodePen 23 (27m) sep 19
Churn.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 168 (1h06) sep 19
Josh Owens - 2007 Rails Rumble Winner; Bonus Meteor Intro.
Ruby5 497 (5m) sep 19
Fourchette, helioth, hutils, toshi, byebug.

item.title: Green Ruby News #084
item.description: If you are not far from Denver in the US, you may need to know that this week there is the Denver Startup Week by Thoughtbot. I hope they will put some videos online.
item.content:encoded:
#084 - sep 14th 2014

Edito

If you are not far from Denver in the US, you may need to know that this week there is the Denver Startup Week by Thoughtbot. I hope they will put some videos online.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
No more snooze
Sleep, the scientific approach, plus the brutal approach.
For the badges
Badges for badge sake.
Nice Portfolio
A curated showcase of the best design portfolios on the web.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Git Colony
Submit your code, get it reviewed by the colony. Code review gamified.
Typing.io
Typing Practice for Programmers.
Secrets of the Browser Developer Tools
Covers developer tools in Chrome, Firebug, Firefox, Internet Explorer, Opera and Safari.
10 Free Books for Learning JavaScript
Stay up to speed with Javascript.
Githut
Github languages statistics.
CommonMark
A strongly specified, highly compatible implementation of Markdown.
Polyfill as a Service
A CDN for polyfills.
Gulp fiction
Online Gulpfile builder.
TinyCert
Free SSL certificates for developers.
Git pretty
Printable chart of various possible git operations.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Rails 4.1.6 and 4.0.10
No big change in this release, essentially bug fixes.
Upmin-admin
An admin dashboard engine for rails, similar to active-admin.
ThemeBandit
Convert any site theme template (Wordpress, Joomla, etc) into a rack application.
factory_girl-preload
Preload factories just like fixtures.
Hello.js
Client-side Javascript SDK for authenticating with OAuth2.
DataCollection.js
Manipulate data from API responses with ease.
Blackbox
Safely store secrets in Git/Mercurial.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
3D Objects With Babylon.js sep 5
Javascript Framework for HTML5 and WebGL Games.
Chef Basics for Rails Developers sep 8
Configure a new server and install a sample Rails Application.
Rails 5, Module#prepend, and the End of alias_method_chain sep 8
Some interesting news about the upcoming Rails 5.
Two pretty-good techniques for styling tricky form elements sep 8
Radio buttons, select and file uploads, and tricks to tweak them.
Write Reliable, Asynchronous Integration Tests With Capybara sep 10
Integration tests involving Ruby and JavaScript.
Automatic Docker Service Announcement with Registrator sep 10
Registrator is inspired by Skydock, but more generic and multihost.
Running and upgrading MySQL servers in Docker containers (or not) sep 11
Few options and issues with possible solutions for database containers.
Oga: a new XML/HTML parser for Ruby sep 11
Another XML/HTML parser that works on more ruby implementations than Nokogiri, and it's faster.
Introducing Helioth: Feature Flipping Gem sep 11
Manage feature flags for progressive feature releases.
Work On An Existing Rails App sep 12
First steps to follow when you enter into a new codebase.
15 Best CSS Tools to Speed Up Your Coding sep 13
Various tools for CSS designers.
Spend less time waiting, more time Cheffing sep 13
Tricks to accelerate testing under Vagrant with Chef.
Configuring macbook for rails development with automated scripts sep 13
Description of the osx_provision gem.
3 Simple examples from Ruby to Elixir sep 14
How to transform a simple script from Ruby to Elixir.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...
GoRails #23 (24m) sep 7
Consuming an API Using HTTParty and Creating a Gem.
AtoZ CSS: @support (7m) sep 9
How to provide alternative styles for unsupported features.
Feature Flagging with Ruby on Rails Engines (18m) sep 11
Rails engines, and deployment on different servers leveraging feature flags.

Listen

What could be heard last week ..
Giant robots #115 (37m) sep 8
There's a Spectrum Involved Here (Brandon Bloom).
Web platform #10 (59m) sep 9
Mathematics & Dynamic CSS Visualizations.
Arrested DevOps 20 (1h06) sep 9
Something About Security with Ben Hughes, Security Manager at Etsy.
Ruby5 494 (6m) sep 9
RSpec 3.1, Rack::Tracker, new features in Rails 4.2, Fearless Rails Deployment book, The_Metal, RubyConf Portugal.
Ruby Rogues 173 (1h10) sep 10
ActiveRecord CRUD with Eileen Uchitelle.
Javascript Jabber 125 (43m) sep 10
WebGL with Sean Griffin.
CodePen 22 (45m) sep 11
Using advertising as part of a business model as well as using advertising to grow.
Ruby on Rails Podcast 167 (58m) sep 11
Kelli Shaver - 2013 Rails Rumble Solo Winner.
Ruby5 495 (6m) sep 12
@rubystrings, Coderetreat 2014, Capybara, nice rake tasks, module prepend.
The Cloudcast #161 (28m) sep 12
Transitioning from CTO to VC.
The ship show #48 (1h04) sep 12
Continuous All The Things: FlowCon 2014.
2ddu #35 (1h15) sep 12
What Go is and its place in the universe of programming languages.

item.title: Green Ruby News #083
item.description: This week there is some progress on the future version of Green Ruby website, you can check https://github.com/greenruby/grn-js if you are curious. And if you want to contribute, you are welcome to join us (just send a mail to mose@greenruby.org). Thanks Quentin, Greg, Jared, Xenor and Pooyan that already jumped in.
item.content:encoded:
#083 - sep 7th 2014

Edito

This week there is some progress on the future version of Green Ruby website, you can check https://github.com/greenruby/grn-js if you are curious. And if you want to contribute, you are welcome to join us (just send a mail to mose@greenruby.org). Thanks Quentin, Greg, Jared, Xenor and Pooyan that already jumped in.

  mose - the green ruby editor
  xenor - the informer
  http://greenruby.org

Look

Examples of UI/UX, graphic performance, web design and flashy things.
The 100 Greatest Free Fonts for 2014
All kinds of typefaces which can be seamlessly integrated into any design.
Tab Styles Inspiration
A small collection of styles for tabs.
20 Useful Docs and Guides for Front-End Developers sep 5
A small collection of styles for tabs.
What are the best programming fonts?
Around 50 fonts reviewed.

Use

Web applications, resources and tools, available for making our life easier or funnier.
Gridlover
The tool to establish a typographic system with modular scale and vertical rhythm.
Zerotier
Network Virtualization Everywhere.
Kobra
Collaborative code editor, plus video and voice.

Install

A selection of gems or applications updated during past week.
Kitematic
The easiest way to start using Docker on your Mac (with a UI, even).
Impulse
Library for building dynamic physics based interactions, with a focus on mobile web.
Neo4j.rb 3.0.rc
Ruby driver for the Neo4j graph database.
Gravit
New and fresh thinking open source design tool (written in HTML5/js/css).
Consul 0.4
Solution for service discovery, configuration, and orchestration.
AMCSS
Use HTML attributes and their values rather than classes for styling elements.
Transcrypt
Transparently encrypt files within a git repository.
AngularStrap
AngularJS 1.2+ native directives for Bootstrap 3.

Read

From the blogosphere or news feeds ...
Rails Authorization sep 1
How to control access in a Rails application, with Pundit or others.
SOA and Rails - Overview sep 1
Review of all the ways to implement a scalable SOA architecture.
Git: The Safety Net for Your Projects sep 2
Various insights about git, and special attention to branches, reset vs revert, bisect.
SOA and Rails - using HTTP sep 2
Part 2 of this collection of great articles about SOA, this one focus on HTTP exchanges.
SOA and Rails - using AMQP sep 3
Part 3 of the articles about SOA, now checking the AMQP way.
Service objects in Rails sep 3
To design clean and maintainable code.
Back to Basics: SOLID sep 3
Five fundamental principles that help engineers write maintainable code.
Verifying Doubles in RSpec 3 sep 3
Create test doubles that verify themselves as conforming to the same interface as a 'real' object.
SOA and Rails - Introducing RackRabbit sep 4
Part 4 about SOA, with a custom MQ solution, alternative to bunny.
Different controllers for different contexts sep 4
Making your application easier to understand, maintain and grow.
Drop-in Responsive Styles With Sass sep 4
Clever usage of a +responsive mixin in SASS.
An Introduction to WebGL sep 5
From zero to a working 3D application, how the various concepts work and why.
How to design APIs that last sep 5
Initial design principles which help building long lived APIs.

Watch

Screencasts and conferences videos, or other video feeds ...

CLI Monday: column and tr.
AtoZ CSS: Required (5m) sep 2
Using :required and other state-based pseudo classes.

Listen

CodePen 21 (36m) sep 2
Planning new features.
Web platform #9 (1h03) sep 3
